name: Rhystic Syphon
text: Unless target player pays {3}, he or she loses 5 life and you gain 5 life.

editions.flavor: Jamuraan wizards are linked together by magic, a bond that only the wicked dare exploit.

name: Rhystic Tutor
text: Unless any player pays {2}, search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Any lock can be undone, any secret revealed.

name: Ribbons
text:
Aftermath (Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.)
Each opponent loses X life.

name: Ribbon Snake
text:
Flying
{2}: Ribbon Snake loses flying until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

editions.flavor: All snakes slither. Only this one soars.

name: Ribbons of Night
text: Ribbons of Night deals 4 damage to target creature and you gain 4 life. If {U} was spent to cast Ribbons of Night, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"My favorite meal is angel's flesh, slain in agony and iced with black vinegar."
—Aszala of House Dimir

name: Ribbons of the Reikai
text: Draw a card for each Spirit you control.

editions.flavor:
"If wisdom is a river, then we cup our hands, reach in, and drink from it in sips. The kami, however, are like fish, swimming, breathing, surrounded in its presence."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

name: Rib Cage Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: Everything it sees it considers food—and with that many eyes, it's not liable to miss much.

name: Richard Garfield, Ph.D.
text: You may play cards as though they were other Magic cards of your choice with the same mana cost. (Mana cost includes color.) You can't choose the same card twice.

editions.flavor: And yea he doth spake: "Let there be Magic."

name: Riches
text:
Aftermath (Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.)
Each opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. You gain control of those creatures.

name: Ricochet
text: Whenever any spell targets a single player, each player rolls a six-sided die. That spell is redirected to the player or players with the lowest die roll. If two or more players tie for the lowest die roll, they reroll until there is no tie.

name: Ricochet Trap
text:
If an opponent cast a blue spell this turn, you may pay {R} rather than pay Ricochet Trap's mana cost.
Change the target of target spell with a single target.

editions.flavor: In his last seconds, Remhas regretted using his most powerful spell.

name: Riddlekeeper
text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, that creature's controller puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Fools surrender their sanity to his riddles. Even greater fools try to solve them.

name: Riddle of Lightning
text: Choose target creature or player. Scry 3, then reveal the top card of your library. Riddle of Lightning deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that creature or player. (To scry 3, look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Riddlesmith
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

editions.flavor: The Neurok see the artificer as an archaeologist, clearing away falsehoods to see the truth hidden beneath.

name: Ride Down
text: Destroy target blocking creature. Creatures that were blocked by that creature this combat gain trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"I will wash you from my hooves!"
—Mardu taunt
The Order of Saint Traft cleared the roads of cultists and horrors, opening the way for the villagers to flee Thraben.

name: Riders of Gavony
text:
Vigilance
As Riders of Gavony enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Human creatures you control have protection from creatures of the chosen type.

name: Ridged Kusite
text: {1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"It offers but a taste of the power that the shadows have to offer. But even that is a heady wine indeed."
—Ratadrabik of Urborg

name: Ridgeline Rager
text: {R}: Ridgeline Rager gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: While armies battled across Jamuraa, beasts stalked the high places looking for victims.
While armies battled across Jamuraa, beasts stalked the high places looking for victims.

name: Ridge Rannet
text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor:
"Only those with the strength to seize their destiny deserve to have one."
—Nacatl scratchforms

name: Ridgescale Tusker
text: When Ridgescale Tusker enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control.

editions.flavor:
"Each creature holds a solution to a problem, a lesson to be learned."
—Oviya Pashiri, sage lifecrafter

name: Ridgetop Raptor
text: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

editions.flavor:
"The Skirk Ridge has many wonderful things to discover—like escape routes."
—Foothill guide

name: Riding Red Hare
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

editions.flavor: One of the greatest steeds in the empire, Red Hare could travel a thousand li a day and climb hills as if running on flat ground.

name: Riding the Dilu Horse
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship. This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor:
"All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change."
—Liu Bei, after being told that the
Dilu brings its master ill fortune

"All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change."
—Liu Bei, after being told that the Dilu brings its master ill fortune

name: Rift Bolt
text:
Rift Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Suspend 1—{R} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {R} and exile it with a time counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

name: Rift Elemental
text: {1}{R}, Remove a time counter from a permanent you control or suspended card you own: Rift Elemental gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"It's difficult to heal a rift after it begins wandering about on its own."
—Teferi

"It's difficult to heal a rift after it begins wandering about on its own."
—Teferi

name: Riftmarked Knight
text:
Protection from black; flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Suspend 3—{1}{W}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W}{W} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
When the last time counter is removed from Riftmarked Knight while it's exiled, create a 2/2 black Knight creature token with flanking, protection from white, and haste.

name: Riftstone Portal
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
As long as Riftstone Portal is in your graveyard, lands you control have "{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool."

name: Riftsweeper
text: When Riftsweeper enters the battlefield, choose target face-up exiled card. Its owner shuffles it into his or her library.

editions.flavor: "Beings of the rifts are not natural. No longer will these abominations tread upon the body of Gaea."
"Beings of the rifts are not natural. No longer will these abominations tread upon the body of Gaea."

name: Riftwing Cloudskate
text:
Flying
When Riftwing Cloudskate enters the battlefield, return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Suspend 3—{1}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{U} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Righteous Aura
text: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

editions.flavor:
"Good is not a ‘thing.' You can neither touch nor own it. No, Good is a vision we all share and strive to make real."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

"There is a great difference between pain and injury."
—Cho-Manno

name: Righteous Authority
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each card in its controller's hand.
At the beginning of the draw step of enchanted creature's controller, that player draws an additional card.

name: Righteous Avengers
text: Plainswalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Plains.)

editions.flavor: Few can withstand the wrath of the righteous.
Few can withstand the wrath of the righteous.

name: Righteous Blow
text: Righteous Blow deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor:
"Monsters will no longer find safety under the mists of Morkrut!"
—Bruna, Light of Alabaster

name: Righteous Cause
text: Whenever a creature attacks, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Until the world unites in vengeful fury and Phage is destroyed, I will not stay my hand."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

"Until the world unites in vengeful fury and Phage is destroyed, I will not stay my hand."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor:
"Until the world unites in vengeful fury and Phage is destroyed, I will not stay my hand."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

"Until the world unites in vengeful fury and Phage is destroyed, I will not stay my hand."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

name: Righteous Charge
text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.
"In the name of peace, moderation, and decency—wipe them all out!"

"Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal
Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.

name: Righteous Confluence
text:
Choose three. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.
• Exile target enchantment.
• You gain 5 life.

name: Righteous Fury
text: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

name: Righteous Indignation
text: Whenever a creature blocks a black or red creature, the blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "You are the disease that plagues Mercadia. I am the healer's knife that will cut you out."

name: Righteousness
text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.
Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.
Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

"I too shall be brought low by death, but until then let me win glory."
—Homer, Iliad, Book XVIII
Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

name: Righteous War
text:
White creatures you control have protection from black.
Black creatures you control have protection from white.

editions.flavor:
"This is a war without neutrality."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Riku of Two Reflections
text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {U}{R}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {G}{U}. If you do, create a token that's a copy of that creature.

name: Rimebound Dead
text: {S}: Regenerate Rimebound Dead. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

editions.flavor:
"Tresserhorn is ours now. Dredge the lake and bring me all the bones you find. We'll build you a new army, the likes of which Terisiare has never seen."
—Heidar, Rimewind master, to Haakon

name: Rime Dryad
text: Snow forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a snow Forest.)

editions.flavor:
"The Dryads told us to stay, as no new horrors would come when it was so cold. Three of us left anyway. The rest believed their lies, and their skeletons weren't found until the thaw."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

name: Rimefeather Owl
text:
Flying
Rimefeather Owl's power and toughness are each equal to the number of snow permanents on the battlefield.
{1}{S}: Put an ice counter on target permanent.
Permanents with ice counters on them are snow.

name: Rimehorn Aurochs
text:
Trample
Whenever Rimehorn Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
{2}{S}: Target creature blocks target creature this turn if able. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

name: Rimescale Dragon
text:
Flying
{2}{S}: Tap target creature and put an ice counter on it. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
Creatures with ice counters on them don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

name: Rime Transfusion
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has "{S}: This creature can't be blocked this turn except by snow creatures." ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

editions.flavor: The unfortunates so transformed hungered not for flesh, but for warmth.

name: Rimewind Cryomancer
text: {1}, {T}: Counter target activated ability. Activate this ability only if you control four or more snow permanents. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

editions.flavor: "The Thaw brings flooding, disease, and death. We will do all in our power to bring frigid peace back to the world."

name: Rimewind Taskmage
text: {1}, {T}: You may tap or untap target permanent. Activate this ability only if you control four or more snow permanents.

editions.flavor: "Find solace in the sun? Burning, blinding, laying secrets bare? No, solace is found under the blanket of cold."

name: Ring of Evos Isle
text:
{2}: Equipped creature gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on equipped creature if it's blue.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Ring of Gix
text:
Echo {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor: Not every cage is made of bars.
Not every cage is made of bars.

name: Ring of Immortals
text: {3}, {T}: Counter target instant or Aura spell that targets a permanent you control.

name: Ring of Kalonia
text:
Equipped creature has trample. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on equipped creature if it's green.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Ring of Ma'rûf
text: {5}, {T}, Exile Ring of Ma'rûf: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand.

name: Ring of Renewal
text: {5}, {T}: Discard a card at random, then draw two cards.

editions.flavor: To the uninitiated, the Ring of Renewal is merely an oddity. For those fluent in the wielding of magic, however, it is a source of great knowledge.
To the uninitiated, the Ring of Renewal is merely an oddity. For those fluent in the wielding of magic, however, it is a source of great knowledge.

name: Ring of Three Wishes
text:
Ring of Three Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.
{5}, {T}, Remove a wish counter from Ring of Three Wishes: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Ring of Thune
text:
Equipped creature has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on equipped creature if it's white.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Ring of Valkas
text:
Equipped creature has haste. (It can attack and {T} no matter when it came under your control.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on equipped creature if it's red.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Ring of Xathrid
text:
{2}: Regenerate equipped creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on equipped creature if it's black.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Ringskipper
text:
Flying
When Ringskipper dies, clash with an opponent. If you win, return Ringskipper to its owner's hand. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Rings of Brighthearth
text: Whenever you activate an ability, if it isn't a mana ability, you may pay {2}. If you do, copy that ability. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: Crafted in emulation of dwarven hearth decorations, these devices doubled the output of Amrit Vatyam's forges.

"Without flame, there would be no iron tools, no cooked meals, no purge of old growth to make room for new."
—Brighthearth creed

name: Ringwarden Owl
text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: The owls learn of mana from the mages who know it best.

name: Riot Control
text: You gain 1 life for each creature your opponents control. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Ravnicans need order. If they don't have it, we shall bring it to them."
—Isperia
Devils are demons' unearthly desires made flesh. Let loose on the world, they satisfy their mad craving for destruction in a whirlwind of chaos.

name: Riot Gear
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+2.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor: Any meeting between guilds requires proper equipment.

name: Riot Piker
text:
First strike
Riot Piker attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: He doesn't care whether he's rioting about trade rights or just having a drunken brawl. He wakes up every morning eager to smash some heads.

name: Riot Ringleader
text: Whenever Riot Ringleader attacks, Human creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "So the vampires like hot blood, do they? Let's see how they handle ours."

name: Riot Spikes
text:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.

editions.flavor: Most auramancers would have let the spikes hover just above the skin. Having the spikes rip through the skin from beneath was a touch added by Rakdos himself.

name: Riparian Tiger
text:
Trample
When Riparian Tiger enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Riparian Tiger attacks, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Rip-Clan Crasher
text: Haste

editions.flavor: If you breathe, she will fight you. If you breathe fire, she must fight you.

name: Ripscale Predator
text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor: As Ravnica's wilds expanded, even advocates for nature had to confront fiercer natural threats.

name: Riptide
text: Tap all blue creatures.

name: Riptide Biologist
text:
Protection from Beasts
Morph {2}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: "I gave it two choices: life in the lab or death in the hunt."

name: Riptide Chimera
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an enchantment you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"I want one."
—Kiora

name: Riptide Chronologist
text: {U}, Sacrifice Riptide Chronologist: Untap all creatures of the creature type of your choice.

editions.flavor: The wizard consulted the Riptide Project about how to further his research. He wasn't prepared for what they told him.

name: Riptide Crab
text:
Vigilance
When Riptide Crab dies, draw a card.

editions.flavor: It sleeps with its claws open.

name: Riptide Director
text: {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Draw a card for each Wizard you control.

editions.flavor: Those who lead others to wisdom become the wisest themselves.

name: Riptide Entrancer
text:
Whenever Riptide Entrancer deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, gain control of target creature that player controls. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
Morph {U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Riptide Laboratory
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}, {T}: Return target Wizard you control to its owner's hand.

name: Riptide Mangler
text: {1}{U}: Change Riptide Mangler's base power to target creature's power. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor: It wants you to be its chum.

name: Riptide Pilferer
text:
Whenever Riptide Pilferer deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Morph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Riptide Replicator
text:
As Riptide Replicator enters the battlefield, choose a color and a creature type.
Riptide Replicator enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
{4}, {T}: Create an X/X creature token of the chosen color and type, where X is the number of charge counters on Riptide Replicator.

name: Riptide Shapeshifter
text: {2}{U}{U}, Sacrifice Riptide Shapeshifter: Choose a creature type. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card of that type. Put that card onto the battlefield and shuffle the rest into your library.

name: Riptide Survivor
text:
Morph {1}{U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Riptide Survivor is turned face up, discard two cards, then draw three cards.

name: Rise
text: Return target creature card from a graveyard and target creature on the battlefield to their owners' hands.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

name: Rise from the Grave
text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

—Liliana Vess

—Liliana Vess

"For my enemies, one death. For my allies, many."
—Liliana Vess

"Don't get too comfortable in there."
—Liliana Vess
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."—Liliana Vess

name: Rise from the Tides
text: Create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token for each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Dear brother, it's sweet that you have chosen to share your toys with Ludevic, but I too have found some new playmates."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

name: Risen Executioner
text:
Risen Executioner can't block.
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
You may cast Risen Executioner from your graveyard if you pay {1} more to cast it for each other creature card in your graveyard.

name: Risen Sanctuary
text: Vigilance

editions.flavor: When one of the great guardians arises, it sweeps enemies aside like chaff yet takes care not to crush a single insect underfoot.

name: Rise of Eagles
text: Create two 2/2 blue Bird enchantment creature tokens with flying. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

editions.flavor: An offering to the sea brings an insight from the stars.

name: Rise of the Dark Realms
text: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor:
"For every living person there are generations of dead. Which realm would you rather rule?"
—Liliana Vess

name: Rise of the Hobgoblins
text:
When Rise of the Hobgoblins enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, create X 1/1 red and white Goblin Soldier creature tokens.
{R/W}: Red creatures and white creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A river even the merrow dare not cross.

name: Rise to the Challenge
text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Plidius wagered that Arissa couldn't kill a chimera with her javelins alone. She proved him wrong in a way everyone could see for days to come.

name: Rishadan Airship
text:
Flying
Rishadan Airship can block only creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: The view is truly spectacular—as long as you don't look at Rishada itself.

name: Rishadan Brigand
text:
Flying
When Rishadan Brigand enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {3}.
Rishadan Brigand can block only creatures with flying.

name: Rishadan Cutpurse
text: When Rishadan Cutpurse enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.

editions.flavor:
The bigger the purse, the greater the fool.
—Rishadan saying

name: Rishadan Footpad
text: When Rishadan Footpad enters the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {2}.

editions.flavor: "The best things in life are free. Money, for instance."

name: Rishadan Pawnshop
text: {2}, {T}: Shuffle target nontoken permanent you control into its owner's library.

editions.flavor: Everything comes to the waterfront eventually, on the tide or on credit.

name: Rishadan Port
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Tap target land.

editions.flavor: Rishada is the gateway to free trade—but the key will cost you.

name: Rishkar, Peema Renegade
text:
When Rishkar, Peema Renegade enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.
Each creature you control with a counter on it has "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: "Aether is the soul of Kaladesh, and all souls should be free."
